messages.message: <!subteam^S01DXHX6FPT> I'm running into issues related to file service while setting up instabase for m&t at mandt.instabase.com (http://mandt.instabase.com). Could someone please help me with this?
Hi @sid - what issue are you running into?

hey, i just keep getting the spinner when i click on Instabase Drive in a new subspace, and have observed the following:

with webapp's ENABLE_FILE_SERVICE_V2=True,
• container file-tservice logs:
```{/instabase/file-tservice/instabase/storage/fileservice/localclient.py:40} INFO - File does not exist /home/ibuser/data/f70951db-eb95-4168-8eef-a8ffb767b1f7/
{/instabase/file-tservice/instabase/storage/fileservice/util/fs_common.py:91} ERROR - : Folder does not exist```
• container grpc-file-service logs: 
```ERROR utils/rpc/thrift_pool.go:169 -- Client error: Failed to get mount details: EOF```
with ENABLE_FILE_SERVICE_V2=False, only file-tservice logs, but it's the same error. for comparison, https://ib.azure-dogfood.instabase.com/ is also on similar infra (Azure/AKS/Azure Files/NFS PV), and works fine. any insights please?
Can you share the config you are using for mounting the PV in file service?
So the deployment yaml for the Volume section in file-tservice.
Thanks!  Can you also share the logs and deployment yaml for mount service?
in case you are looking to join
Resolved ^ disabling file-service-v2. There is an issue (https://instabase.atlassian.net/browse/CS-839) with grpc-file-service when using localfs for Instabase Drive. We’ll get this fixed!
